page.title: 03LOWICK
page.content: The population consists of a mixture of professional people and Estate workers. It is the families of Estate workers who are the true 'locals'. During the day the village is almost deserted, as those who work are either in the nearby towns or are at work on the Manor farms. The children go to schools in Thrapston or Oundle. There are a few elderly people at home during the day. The Mothers'Union is the only group meeting on a regular basis in the village. Most other activities being persued in nearby towns. Gardening seems to be the most popular pastime. Most gardens have a vegetable plot.
